com.week9.io

Class FileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.week9.io.FileSystem

  • public class FileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the file system beginning with a root element. The root element may be a file or a directory. A FileSystem my be visited by a FileVisitor by using the accept(FileVisitor) method.
    See Also:
    FileVisitor, FileVisitResult

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileSystem(java.io.File rootPath)
      Instantiate a file system with a given root path.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileSystem

        public FileSystem(java.io.File rootPath)

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if rootPath does not exist

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        public void accept(FileVisitor v)
        Shows the given FileVisitor every element in this FileSystem. Thus recursively goes through this FileSystem and calls FileVisitor.visitFile(File) for every file in every directory of this FileSystem. Also calls FileVisitor.preVisitDirectory(File) before entering a directory and FileVisitor.postVisitDirectory(File) after leaving a fully read directory, i.e. after every element inside a directory has been visited. Will stop visiting elements in this FileSystem if FileVisitResult.TERMINATE is returned by the FileVisitor. Will not visit the elements inside a directory, if FileVisitResult.SKIP_SUBTREE is returned by the FileVisitors FileVisitor.preVisitDirectory(File) method.
        Parameters:
        v - the Visitor that shall see all elements in this FileSystem.
